intro: Oenothera alyssoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow or orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant has slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Oenothera alyssoides is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
